content: E By: Eric Pratum January 15, 2013 What Five Experts have to Say About Measuring Social Media Social Media BlitzLocal CEO Dennis Yu, genius marketer Ian Lurie, EdgeRank expert Chad Wittman, Social Nerdia founder & Sprinklr director and strategist Esteban Contreras, and awesome marketing podcast host and consultant Bob Knorpp were kind enough to help me look at measuring and valuing social media based on their experience and knowledge. Read this post By: Mackenzie Fogelson January 15, 2013 Building Community with Value Social Media At the heart of community building strategy, there is a need to share and provide something of value to others. Check out these tips to ensure you're spending time and resources on types of content that are valuable to potential community members you're hoping to attract. Read this post By: Peter Bray December 20, 2012 Introducing New Followerwonk Engagement Metrics for Twitter Social Media The holidays came early for the Moz community. We're excited to announce some cool new metrics to Followerwonk, including Engagement (composed of Retweet and @Contact rates) and Tweets with URLs! Read this post By: Peter Bray December 6, 2012 Justin Bieber Gets 32K Retweets Per Tweet - Can You Beat That? Social Media Oh, how sacred those retweets are! Peter Bray unveils the data behind how the ultimate Twitter king gets over 32K retweets per tweet, and puts perspective on how you, too, might be able to beat the Biebs on Twitter. Read this post By: Nathan Latka December 5, 2012 7 Key Ways to Optimize Facebook Fan Page SEO (along with Mozinar Q&A) Social Media The "Social Media for the SEO Mind" Mozinar was a great way to learn about SEO-optimization for social engagement on websites and fan pages. In today's post, Nathan Latka answers your Q&A questions and gives a few more amazing tips on optimizing your Facebook fan page for SEO. Read this post By: Scott Tobin December 5, 2012 Dear Social Media, Your 15 Minutes of Fame Are Up Social Media When Facebook hit the scene for businesses, everyone was in a frenzy to get a Facebook page and businesses spent countless hours and dollars listening to self-proclaimed “Social Media Experts” on what they should be doing. Almost three years later, these experts are still grasping for some kind of evidence that their advice is generating a return on investment for their clients. Read this post By: AmyFowler50 November 30, 2012 13 Ideas for Interesting, Engaging, and Just Plain Awesome Tweets for Business Social Media Using Twitter for business can be a lot of fun – but this doesn’t mean it’s always easy. Figuring out what to Tweet can be mind boggling, and it can be easy to fall into the trap of just Retweeting what other people are saying. Thankfully, if you think before you Tweet, it doesn’t have to be this way. Read this post By: Peter Bray November 12, 2012 When Is My Tweet's Prime of Life? (A brief statistical interlude.) Social Media We use many tools to tailor our Twitter use, but how can we accurately measure the lifespan of a tweet? Peter Bray digs into the data and uses retweets (i.e. the currency of Twitter) to predict just how long your tweet's prime of life will be. Read this post By: Jayson DeMers November 6, 2012 Your Guide to Social Signals for SEO Social Media Social signals are paving the way for the future of search, but just how much influence might they have on the SERPs? To understand where we're going, it's time to look at how social signals are currently affecting rankings and take the necessary steps to improve them on your website. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard October 16, 2012 10 Dead Simple Tips to Take Advantage of Google+ for SEO Social Media It's no secret. When engineers built Google+, they constructed an SEO juggernaut to dominate search results above all other social platforms. Although true that Facebook and Twitter are essential to many marketing efforts, but both restrict Google from accessing much of their data. Here’s an experiment... Read this post By: Joanna Lord October 9, 2012 5 Facebook Marketing Resources You Didn't Know About Social Media Facebook advertising is here to stay, and marketers are spending more time and money on their platform than ever before. Joanna Lord discusses five of Facebook's best-kept secret resources to help marketers get the most out of their Facebook experience. Read this post J By: Justin Vanning October 3, 2012 Facebook's New Custom Audiences: What They Are and How You Can Use Them - Part 1 Social Media If you're currently advertising on Facebook, you've probably heard the announcement about their new Custom Audience feature. In this post, Justin Vanning provides an overview of the new feature and tips on how you can use it to your advantage. Read this post D By: DanaLookadoo September 19, 2012 Rock Your SEO with Structured Social Sharing - #MozCon Presentation Social Media During my talk at MozCon 2012, attendees learned about the Structured Social Sharing Formula (SSSF): 10 steps to optimize and track social share snippets on Facebook, Google Plus, and Twitter. The formula includes use of microdata and best practices for controlling the snippet that displays on Facebook and Google+ as well as how to automatically tag URLs with... Read this post By: Will Critchlow August 23, 2012 Do Improved Social Signals Cause Improved Rankings? Social Media Everyone in search is by now aware that certain social signals are well-correlated with rankings. However, does correlation always imply causation? Will takes us through a study to test the plausibility of correlations arising without social signals being a direct ranking factor. Read this post
